snippet: Throughout Syria’s long and bloody uprising, the capital had remained largely insulated from events elsewhere, but that changed with decisive suddenness on Wednesday.
abstract: Damascus has remained largely insulated from events elsewhere, but that has changed after bombing that killed the country’s crucial security figures; many people outside of politics speak of fleeing to Beirut, although blockades make that impossible; Assad supporters are outraged and fear is spreading that the war will turn into a Sunni-Alawite confrontation.

byline.contributor: Dalal Mawad and Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut and Hala Droubi from Dubai, United Arab Emirates.

lead_paragraph: Throughout Syria’s long and bloody uprising, the capital had remained largely insulated from events elsewhere, but that changed with decisive suddenness on Wednesday.

headline.seo: Bombing Attack Shifts Equation in Syria Uprising
headline.main: Damascus Confronts New Reality After Attack
headline.print_headline: Damascus Confronts New Reality After Attack

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
